Requirements

Project Background

Moorfields eye Hospital is a prestigious NHS eye hospital located in London. More than 25(not sure) specialised ocularist and admins work in this hospital. Alongside their busy daily schedule , ocularists have to put in a huge amount of time in the process of booking appointments. This is because the current booking system used by moorfields eye hosiptal is not quite efficient.
Data about patients and appointments are fragmented and stored in seperate excel spread sheets. For example: There is a rota spread sheet storing appointment timetable for a ocularist. The details of appointments on the timetable are stored in a different spreadsheets while patients'information and waitlists are kept in another spreadsheet. Therefore, in order for ocularists to book in appointments, they have to navigate across many spreadsheets and make changes a lot of times.
Another major drawback of the current system is that a huge amount of informations are presented to ocularist at once which makes it difficult to read needed and can be overwhelming. This process costs extra precious time for ocularists and admins which they could use on work. Moorfields eye hospital came to us looking for a streamline and easy-to-operate booking system to save time for their employeers.

This is a Rota spreadsheet used in previous booking system. No real data used

This is a waitlist spreadsheet used in previous booking system. No real data used

Client Requirements

We set up weekly virtual meetings with Moorfield eye hospital representatives to communicate about their requirements and our progresses. During the meeting we had, moorfield talked us through the details of scheduling from receiving a patient's referral to putting an appointment to a slot. This helps us to design the system and user interface in a way that our clients are familiar with. They also told us types of information needed to be stored in system which helps with database design.

After the first few meetings, we refined these main requirements from our client:
1. An easy way to book in and reschedule appointments.
2. An esay way to view patients' information and relative data.
3. Allow multiple people to edit data at once.
4. Multi-platforms, allow ocularists to check their timetable through phone.

Pain points

1. Unreadable data presentation
2. Too repetitive work to book appointments
3. Ocularists can’t edit spreadsheets at once without overwriting each others changes.

Solutions

1. We implement filter, search and expanding window functionality so ocularists can only see the information that they want to see
2.System will manage database rather than the ocularist, this means triaging patients will no longer be a tedious process
3. Implementing synchronisation between the ocularists will lead to less frustration when trying to edit the patients information

Project Goal

Our goal is to develop a workflow management webapp for Moorfields Eye Hospital. It can be deployed and embedded into NHS standard websites as well as receive data from NHS PAS(The PatientSource Patient Administration System ) system. It provides ocularists and admins simple ways to modify andd read about their daily schedules.

Interviews/Surveys

To gather the user requirements, we conducted a semi-structured interview and a likert scale survey. Upon evaluation, this was the best way to gather the user requirements.Here are a few notable responses from a member of each user group.

Q: What features of the current system do you like?

A:“Data is organised and on different spreadsheets, so you know where to look for a specific piece of information, e.g to check if a patient is on the waiting list, I “search for them in the waiting list spreadsheet”

Q: What features of the current system do you dislike?

A:“Data is on different spreadsheets is also a downside, for example to book a patient in, you must remove/process this on multiple spreadsheets, this process is time consuming and a waste of a specialists time”
A:“It also isn't possible to view all information we have about a patient and their bookings all at once, as it is fragmented across multiple spreadsheets.”
A:“On a spreadsheet it is hard to be able to view only the information that I want, this can make me feel overwhelmed by the amount of information shown to me.
A:“Not very user friendly, nor consistent. Some boxes have a dropdown list, some don't, have to manually maintain all spreadsheets”

Q: Is there anything in particular that should be added/changed?

A: “Some sort of process to automate/speed up the rescheduling of appointments would be incredibly helpful. As a lot of my time is spend rescheduling, by speeding up this process, I will be able to do my job better, faster and more accurately.”
